assignments.description: Used if values entered in previous screen value have changed
assignments.name: updateAddress_Assignments
assignments.label: updateAddress Assignments

Flow.description: Created to manage the record creation process needed to demonstrate sliding in SFS - referenced in the Field Service Console as a gannt action.
Flow.interviewLabel: SDO SFS Create 5 WO for Sliding {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}
Flow.label: SDO SFS Create 5 WO for Sliding

fields.name: InfoText
fields.fieldText:
This flow will create 5 Work Orders and Service Appointments which will allow you to demonstrate sliding. Sliding Script is here.


Unschedule a full day for Alan Reed. Enter that date in the Earliest Start Time Below.


Please note these addresses are for the San Francisco area. If you've moved your data, you will need to enter 5 addresses that are nearby your location.

fields.name: address5Label
fields.fieldText: Address 5 - this is for the Work Order that you will insert with sliding

fields.name: SuccessText
fields.fieldText:
Successfully created these 5 Service Appointments:

{!get_SA1.AppointmentNumber}

{!get_SA1_0.AppointmentNumber}

{!get_SA1_0_0.AppointmentNumber}

{!get_SA1_0_0_0.AppointmentNumber}

{!get_SA1_0_0_0_0.AppointmentNumber}


After this flow runs, run book appointment on the first 4 appointments created, booking them in the following Arrival Windows: 9-11, 11-1, 1-3, 3-5


Then drag and drop the 5th to the 10am start time and note the violations.


Then use book appointment on the 5th one and note how it will magically fit this 5th appointment in between the 1 and 2 ones by sliding the 2nd one over a little, while still preserving it's Arrival Window.


Please review the Sliding Script for the full instructions on how to schedule these. The script is here.
